8HvJz88hdrTsO_AdDSh89w.text: The best chipotle of Pittsburgh. Sometimes the lines are a bit ridiculous but the food is by far superior and consistent to other locations of the same area so I'll gladly wait the extra 5-10 minutes because they can clear a line that's out the door that fast:

la6Qbnz5UnRsaiwHBfqpOw.text: This place is great. Get a burrito bowl if you are watching your calories. My favorite is with the chicken. I'll go back here.

U6PzEeQLfHt-xQdTaJkZtw.text: This place is ok. I prefer a little more variety when making Mexican the what you get here.  I waited for 25 minutes tonight to take food home for dinner.  It was hit but the taste just wasn't there. I don't think I've ever had such a bland guac until tonight. I prefer Moes any day is the week.  Plus GMO food sucks when you have allergies!

2nF1HHrUL5k4gn516MuzLQ.text: This is a great Chipotle location. Outside seating and fast, friendly service. Great fast food option, for just a few bucks more than a greasy "burger" or taco with meat that's less than 20% real meat.  Try the carnitas, hot sauce, and corn salsa in a burrito bowl. Yum!

aHYRByA9je2x1vHWfW-LoQ.text: Chipotle is great - The food is delicious and fresh.  I've been to this location a couple of times in the past 2 weeks and the only reason I don't give it 5 stars is because, surprisingly, there is no baby changing table in either of the bathrooms. There are high chairs for babies, but nowhere to change them.  Had to change my son in his stroller, in the bathroom.  It would be a very easy and relatively inexpensive feat to install a changing table in each bathroom.  Chipotle is supposed to be a family friendly place, let's get it all the way there.

_5WFmRakabGQzbI3Y7uVcQ.text: Me and my husband LOVE it here. We love it. It's our go to place when we don't feel like cooking.  We're here about once a week. It's delicious, it's fast, it's fresh, it's simple, it's clean and the workers are always very nice and they should all get big raises!

Eyy9wTQLVxm3BDLpQBskLQ.text: Unless the company is struggling as a whole, this location is serving weaksauce only. My portion size was a joke. Found a hair,  and chips were stale. Yum.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Weaksauce. Where is the rest of my burrito bowl? Things must be going downhill.

h5hBxcvGqIWXHL9i915rpg.text: I will never go to this location ever again. It was my turn to order and I placed my usual order, a burrito with white rice, chicken, hot salsa, sour cream and guac. Everything was going pretty standard until the employee at the end of the line, a young girl, started to wrap my burrito (which I do not think was 'too full'). She was having a rough time with it (I don't blame her, I would hate wrapping burritos, I probably would suck at it). She started to get the sour cream all over the wrap, the guac fell out and she did not put any more in, I was loosing my protein also. Not even exaggerating, my burrito looked like a murder scene from a kill room on Dexter.  She quickly tried to pass it off on me. I asked her politely if she could rewrap it, she told me it was 'too full' and gave me a nasty attitude while she rewrapped my burrito. Slamming the tortilla on counter aggressively. Throwing a hissy fit and mumbling under her breath. When she was done she literally threw the burrito and it smacked into the cash register.  I asked for the manager, who was very nice and did not make me pay for my burrito, and while I appreciate that very much, the experience alone is enough to make me take my burrito cravings else where.

pZ-pFCLx7lGFCZ01rGtOTA.text: Was our first choice for 'fast' food. They make your order to your desire as you move toward the teller. Portions are very generous. The bowl is for those who do not want to eat the tortilla. Sorry to learn that they use GMO foods and ingredients. Will not be back until they have eliminated toxic GMO foods.

c6sVQv69-BwLxdL69Nyvyg.text: There is one really nice cashier that works here, however the rest weren't very nice tonight. A few friends and I came into the restaurant 30 minutes before closing, and they were cleaning up already. We ventured inside, but we should've turned back as soon as we saw the employees giving us the dirtiest looks. We apologized for coming in so "late" and she gave the shadiest smile, and proceeded to DUMP our food onto our tortillas and bowls. The cashier was also shady, but she wasn't as bad. Then they give us looks and giggle throughout our whole stay. They're rude. Sorry for being an inconvenience, even though it's still operating hours.

fYXwEysSpqQvJvNXByLxkg.text: I'm not a "fast food" person, so I don't feel super-disgusting eating here, and that's a good thing.  Actually, I don't fee disgusting at all.  I love the variety of options available to customize your tacos, burritos, and the like.  My go-to is a chicken burrito bowl with brown rice (I want that recipe, STAT) and all the toppings.  The chips taste delicious if you get one that isn't a salt-lick and the guacamole is great, too.  I don't always spring for guac, though - relatively speaking, it's pricey for the small cup.  While the servers are friendly, the person at the register is always unpleasant.  I've been here multiples times and it's always someone different but with the same sour expression.  They do tend to herd you along, especially towards the end.  Every time I'm here, I feel like I have to pay with a debit card because cash just takes too much time for them.  Heaven forbid I put my change in my wallet before moving away from the register - that will get you a sigh and an eye roll to go with the sour expression.  If you can, come during an off-time if you want to stay there to eat and to minimize the sighs.

ogdIVdRn-LVhB7eZpOXpJg.text: Oh Chipotle why do I love you so? Who would have thought have a few simple ingredients would be such a big hit! You have won me over as a usually fast, simple meal that is kinda sorta good for me. It would be healthy but the handful of cheese and scoop of sour creme make it totally delish but less good for me. Do I care? Nope! I will forever come here for my yummy chicken burrito bowl!

T2u-2NyH8ZgwjxvOpFun7g.text: I love Chipotle. I could eat here once a week. Wait, we DO eat here once a week. The vegetarian options are plentiful- tacos, salads, burritos, burrito bowls, etc. I'm careful to only get the black beans though, as the pinto beans are cooked with bacon. I adore the corn salsa, sweet and a little spicy. When you go veggie, there is no extra charge for their outstanding guacamole, which I typically get on the side. Then if you buy a bag of chips, you've got plenty of guac for dipping and loading up whatever creation you've made! Staff is always fast and friendly. And strangely, the music they play in Chipotle is always pretty awesome. Always appreciated, I'd much rather listen to Sleigh Bells while waiting in line than Michael Bolton.  See you next week, Chipotle!

i7KLWxZZdTxP13GM_LnzcA.text: You know what, I love Chipotle. It's way better than Qdoba, and let's not talk about Mad Mex anymore ever again. You probably don't need a rundown on the menu items, but their guacamole is amazing (pure avocado with minimal extras), their chips are thin and salty and lime-y, and everything else is pretty darn good. I don't love the chicken or the steak, but that's just because I prefer shredded, slow-cooked meat to go with my salsa.  My current favorite thing is just to go with the salad, with pinto beans, carnitas (the only meat there that isn't cooked in soybean oil, just FYI), as much of the pico, tomatillo, and hot salsas as they'll give me, and some cheese. Filling and way less carbs than the burritos, as good as those are. The dressing (a citrus cilantro of some sort) is pretty good too, though you won't need much with that salsa on there.  This location is pretty good; they only rarely turn out overstuffed burritos that split down the side, and they're fast. One of the gals recognizes me and gets the guacamole ready ahead of time, which I always appreciate. The seating area is reasonably accommodating, unless you get there at the same time as an entire Little League team, and they do have patio seating in nicer weather. Parking is easy; getting in and out, not as much, but it's McKnight road, so what can you do?  Heads up: Their exterior door is, for some reason, absurdly heavy, so just be aware of that so you don't look like a putz, as I often manage to do.

9UKQ8Pa52jIjxOUeupwd1g.text: My name is Taylor , I am a regular customer at this chipotle location . Every Thursday I come in for a chicken bowl around 11:30 . Each day I come in , the employees are all super happy and really treat me like a valued customer. Maddie , the cashier , is always greeting me with a smile and taking care of whatever I need . Because I am a regular customer ,  she takes care of my lunch on occasion which is an added bonus to the great service I receive each time I go . Maddie always comes to my table to make sure my lunch is satisfactory and that everything tastes good. Maddie is a great employee and deserves the recognition !

oMn2YD-asGd6JbUjFxbAjw.text: Worst Chipotle experience of my life. The staff was rude, did not have product (which would have been ok if staff had addressed it professionally).  After I paid the line person just left my burrito at the end of the line and walked off...I had to reach into the line to get my paid for meal :-/. Next time I will be going to Qdoba across the street.

sD6xcFRUB_ozIFHpmWyrJQ.text: fast service - only complaint is that since we had never been to one before we didn't even know what they offered to eat.  The menu board is pretty vague for a newbie who didn't have a clue what they served.  I still don't think I could tell you other than a burrito and taco bowl with your choice of meat and toppings.  (maybe that's all they do have)  However, the food was excellent - their guacamole is a True delight.  Very clean environment and clean and well groomed employees who don't rush your with your decisions.    We will go back for sure

5yVqBiY60EYkbW7pEFb8-Q.text: The dining room is a bit small for the size of the lunch crowd here but it's what one expects from a Chipotle. The staff was pretty quick to clean up tables but most of the people who are coming at peak hours should expect to do a quick brush off of the table when they sit down to clean up the prior patron's crumbs.

ajWcW66MAvGFdDiWSWV7Kw.text: Excellent food with a good value. I have never had a bad meal. Great for a quick meal out.

CbIv993K15s04ZoEnEJ9Kw.text: Wow don't order the quesorito, it's like the world may be ending and I promise all people who work there will hate you almost instantly

KPtSh04gvr5rMt508jBK7A.text: Nothing excites me more than when someone says chipotle. Not only is the food delicious, but it is organic and full of flavor! Over the past year or so I have tried just about everything on the menu and I haven't had anything that I dint enjoy. You walk down the bar, they build the burrito, bowl, taco, or salad of your taste buds dreams, then get some chips, guac, or delicious drink and you're on your way to one happy belly! Qdoba is cool and all, but with an amazing company backing Chipotle with their green and organic initiatives, I'll support with my wallet over and over again.   Overall the restaurant is very clean, staff is fantastic, and the outdoor seating is a great feature on a sunny day.

pqzDlBxHoqCF-aPq2hivug.text: I absolutely love chipotle I go to them frequently all over the us....but this particular location SUCKS! They are so rude to customers, no form of good customer service from anyone.  I'm a burrito lover but they can not wrap my burrito at all, no matter how many times I've been there. They've tried to wraps my burrito with three tortillas after the first two burst! Smh I hate this location and I don't hate anything :(

lb02ldoEyRjkJB3VMqYFYQ.text: Everyone know what chipotle is so I'm not even going to get into a giant discussion on the food.  I will say however that the service at this location is fantastic.  Everyone is upbeat and they even remembered me after coming a few days in a row.  Embarrassing?  Maybe, but its hard to find good quick food where I was staying.

uimnhbdOKsfah0XVwedu8g.text: If you are what you eat - then call me a steak burrito! I would eat here all the time if my wallet and waist could afford it. It's never too busy to stop in for a quick lunch and outside seating is available (although right along busy McKnightmare Road). I definitely prefer Chipotle over the Qdoba that is directly across the road from where they built this location.   Try the hot sauce.

vil5-HsWYJwTdaf0Qln9zQ.text: Quick and flavorful and fresh and close to home.  Chipotle puts the 'food' back into 'fast food'.  The perfect place for ordering up a vegetarian meal where you don't have to give up flavor. The rice bowls are my personal faves. The brown rice is actually tasty too.

xb-2gxGo8zJsYmEVgWzbfw.text: I am a big fan of Chipotle as it is a inexpensive healthy alternative to Mcdonalds and Wendy's. I had a bowl to go with white rice chicken green peppers and onions and tomatoes and sour cream and lettuce. the food was delicious and I definitely will be going back as it is near by. The staff are fast and friendly and the place is clean. The store has plenty of seating, But they dont seem to need it as it does not seem to be that busy ever. In any case I love Chipotle and definitely will be going again.

Oaq_7RLsTDW5ZiFOXuXYmg.text: Eh... getting pretty sick of them not having my online order ready 5-10 minutes after the app said it'd be ready. For a few times, I show up, get a deer in headlights look when I say I have an order to pick up, and then end up waiting longer than if I joined the line initially! Drives me crazy.  Also this place was the origin of my most traumatic chipotle experience. I have to share: the person making my burrito punctured the foil and tortilla with the sharpie at the end of the line. The person gave me a new tortilla and added a huge dollop if sour cream under the hot wad of crusty beans and filling from the first try and created this sloppy warm mess of a burrito. Couldn't even finish it.  Would you look at that? They finished my burrito right as I was finished up writing this. 11 minutes over when I supposed to get it.

z0N2pMCQXsUo87DxLRR1Qw.text: No proper greeting to customer. Burnt chicken , less meat , kept actually all things kept very less , covered with sour cream and uncooked rice , salad seems to be out of date. I don't know why they kept a different expressions while serving us . All the staff seems little rude while serving. Never gonna come here again . This was my third time. Guys see the ratings . I think this restaurant has less rating. Inspite of it we came here out of our hunger. Guys improvise in order to attract customers.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

hTax6YYtodaAK78fXPuAjw.text: Food was delicious and they actually speak up so I can hear them at this location! Clean tables and it was very comfortable, even as crowded as it was. The bathrooms needed a good wipe down but besides that, everything was great. The customer service was excellent and they were really polite. I got through the line pretty quickly too so everything went really well here. I'll definitely be back for more!

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wrap
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wrap
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Wrap

CAF9YKuJLfTPvGNuMQHZiw.text: The chips weren't stale this time at least. Service remains mediocre to poor... Portions are comically small.  Why is the queso gritty?!

jl55p_BVmdlI-StTwoQD0A.text: It's a shame because this chipotle is the closest to my house and it's the absolute WORST. Every time I come here, the workers are ignorant and rude, they rush you completely out of the way and don't give a crap how little they put in your bowl. This bowl that I just received, I asked for a little more sour cream, they gave me a dirty looked and literally scooped another entire spoonful onto my bowl. I literally can't taste anything but sour cream now and the bowl is just ruined. Save yourself the frustration and go to the one in mccandless crossing. Avoid this place like the plague.

vZFuS0M8r_9Dtb4vZL0OkQ.text: Poor service. Food is not great at this location. Online orders never ready on time. Food is barely warm

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Suppose to be 3 chicken tacos in this mess

sHEeMfbgk88cUEqcrdWFqg.text: This is absolutely the worst place I have gone to! My order was wrong 6 times!! Even worse when I went to go get my drink, it sprayed Coca-Cola on me! And the workers laughed. Finally I got my bowl and found metal in it! I chipped my tooth! Awful

WVPePIJ_sRps5j6GfZiWUw.text: Better than taco smell. Anyone who complaines about fast food should get a life, you know what you are walking into.

N43D1GksCP6tnFF7Kg0RYw.text: Always love chipotle!!! Was in and out and everything was fresh. I tried the Queso and I was disappointed it tasted like fake processed cheese. Chipotle Corp you can do way better!

JS9Ef2RE2zMBeQS9KUSXng.text: This is a decent chipotle. The seating arrangement is very nice here, there's even a few booths. My bowl had good proportions of food, and it was all very good. The fajita veggies were especially good, lots of colorful peppers as opposed to the usual green ones. Staff was friendly, and it wasn't very busy. Good experience.

eoPu0mAZhi1q5nCqDSB1Kg.text: THERE WAS A DEAD FLY IN MY BOWL. I got takeout from the Chipotle at 4861 McKnight Rd, when I got home and opened my bowl, I saw a DEAD FLY in it. I have uploaded 2 photos in the photos section. I'm sure the fly was from the store because I saw it as soon as I opened the lid and it was dead.  I called the store and asked to speak to the manager. She told me to go back to the store to get a refund for the amount I paid, or a free entry. She did not sound sorry at all. NO APOLOGY, NO ADDITIONAL REIMBURSEMENT. Since I already know their food is not clean, I did not go back.  In addition, my husband has a sensitive stomach and he often got sick after eating there, which generally is an indication of unclean food. But due to the fact that Chipotle's food is so delicious and this location is very close to our home, we still visited a lot -- until I saw a whole fly in my bowl. We definitely won't go back anymore, no matter how delicious the food is. I've also seen a worker there accidentally dropped a plastic dip container into the Guacamole tray, she saw it but didn't pick it up immediately, she went back to work on someone's order, then picked up the container afterwards. After seeing all those details, I don't even want to imagine how they prepare their food. In short, what you eat there is not as clean as you assume.   I want to remind future customers to avoid getting food from this place. If you do, check your food before your eat, to make sure there's nothing like a fly in it.  Chipotle is still good, but this location is the worst.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. THERE WAS A FLY IN MY BOWL. I got takeout from the Chipotle at 4861 McKnight Rd, when I got home and opened my bowl, I saw a FLY in it.

Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. THERE WAS A FLY IN MY BOWL. I got takeout from the Chipotle at 4861 McKnight Rd, when I got home and opened my bowl, I saw a FLY in it.

Vyv0ubj01HRgZIUC2Z6awQ.text: Chipotle is more of a rip off than it was before. Small portions, barely anything is included, 2.00 if you want guacamole on your burrito (basically a tablespoon of guac). Got burrito bowls with my husband tonight with a side of chips and guac (3.00). Left feeling hungry and spent 22.00 altogether. They gave us a ridiculously small amount of chips. I'm going to say approximately 13 chips (not kidding) for two people for 3.00... lower your prices if you're going to give that amount. Super annoying. Probably won't come back for a long time. Not worth the expensive prices.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States

O2WY9Uy8l7OVgDU81iECqQ.text: Food is old and dry. We got there early, 11am. The food. Was obviously from last night. I ordered anyway had to get home. (I eat left overs). I took to bites and threw it away. It was awful!! Staff was friendly. The food was gross! We love chipotle. Never will I go to this one again!

EFjCNlV9iz-TRDjWJQd6Fg.text: After trying multiple Chipotles in Pitt, by far this is my favorite Chipotle. The staff is very friendly, place kept clean (floors are to blame the management). The portions are very generous in comparison to other Chipotles.

NSy5CqNBpqe82UH8dJ8-hQ.text: First time here: we ordered chicken tacos, steak burrito & a steak/chicken bowl. Overall the meat is spicy.. It was fine for some of us but not all. The place was clean and the employees were fine.   Chicken tacos were okay at best. There was plenty of sour cream and cheese but not a lot of chicken (ex: one of my tacos had like 2 bites of chicken).  Steak burrito: good overall. Only problem is that half the burrito is rice & lettuce and on the other side is all of the beans & steak.. So half the burrito is a waste. Next time would order just a bowl to get all of the toppings together.  Steak/chicken bowl: much better option than the burrito. Tasted good. "Pretty hard to mess up."  Chips are REALLY yummy. I love the salt and lime. I would go back just for the chips.  Total for 6 chicken tacos, 1 burrito, 1 bowl, 3 bags of chips & 2 drinks: $39.

photos.caption: Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Steak burrito
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken tacos
Photo of Chipotle Mexican Grill - Pittsburgh, PA, United States. Chicken tacos

rY-zYxkO182ZPvd8zeEfvw.text: its  good for a taco fix    been here  5 time and i have mixed review some days are better  then another for example   chip and dip  to much salt and to saltly dip  black some days  not saltly    steak hard some days super soft and good the food its not the same all the time  again its a quick fix for me   another chipotle  are better for sure but i always pass this one

82gdlUyjFCPrWl8HhIOAgA.text: I like this location of Chipotle. For a fast food place, this restaurant is great.  Yet, my last visit wasn't so pleasant.  We ordered a children's chicken quesadilla, and a salad for me but the quesadilla was left too long in the press and then lost (I assume they gave it to a to-go customer).  My daughter had eaten all the chips waiting for it and by the time we got the (second) quesadilla it was uneatable.   A timer is needed for the quesadilla press. There's no need to cook it, only heat it enough to melt the cheese. A child can't wait for their boiling hot melted cheese to cool off.

k_wj-BQuVlXVnxLpfLLN1w.text: I'm a big fan of this particular Chipotle. Pleasant staff, consistent food, and a clean restaurant. Not to mention, it's rarely busy enough that we've had to stand in a long line.  I usually get a burrito bowl with brown rice, black beans, and chicken, topped with the corn and mild salsas. Surprisingly, there's enough flavor in just those ingredients that I can pass all of the filthier options and be happy with my reasonably-healthy lunch! Whenever we're in the mood for a chain burrito, we typically opt for Chipotle, and this particular location is perfect if you're looking for a quick bite during a long day dealing with McKnight Road shopping/traffic/etc.

CGB_ZaA6bdR5TuG2kHzypw.text: As a frequent patron at this particular McKnight road location, I recommended a group of my friends to go there with me. Regret quickly ensued. Group of four of us walked in at 9:35 pm and was greeted with great disapproval, including exaggerated shoulder shrugs and loud sighing. With these gestures, the staff gave us the impression that our patronage was unwelcome and inconvenient. Exited immediately upon being received with that response. I work too hard for my money to use it to reward such poor customer service. I will not be returning. This is not the only restaurant in the neighborhood, many of them happily welcome customers to their establishments and receive their customers very graciously. I choose to spend my money with establishments that earn my business. Employees attitudes must improve drastically or this establishment doesn't stand a chance at survival in a competitive market. I hope this review can serve to help rectify the situation!
